body.name: 303 Products Fabric Guard - For Outdoor Fabrics - Restores Water Repellent Properties - Repels Moisture & Stains - Manufacturer Recommended - Safe For All Fabrics, 16oz (30605CSR) Packaging May Vary
deliveryMessages: This item cannot be shipped to your selected delivery location. Please choose a different delivery location.
features: Water Repellency – Restores lost water and stain repellency to factory new levels when applied to clean and dry fabrics. This product will leave behind a protective coating which is an active defense against spills and stains.

Stain Resistance – Rejuvenates your fabric's shield against frustrating spots and stains. Simple and easy to use, 303 Fabric Guard helps protect against water-based accidents while drying invisible and keeping fabric vibrant.

Versatile – Does not alter fabric color, feel, flammability, or breathability. Safe for use on all fabrics, as well as synthetic and natural fibers, including upholstery, cushions, umbrellas, life jackets, suede, canvas, and more.

Directions – Use outdoors only, in supplied packaging. Spray product onto fabric until evenly wet, overlapping areas in a crisscross pattern, and let dry. Do not oversaturate. Let cure for 12-24 hours before introducing to liquid.
All 303 Products are good for 5 years after the packaging date on the bottle, and 2 years after the date of opening. Proudly made in the USA by a family-owned company in Chicago, IL.

Due to a recent formula issue, this product may cause a white residue on your fabric. The residue can be removed by using any fabric safe cleaner, dish soap or laundry soap. Please contact the manufacturer for a full refund if you experience this issue.

productInformation.name: Special Features
productInformation.value: ‎This powerful fabric protectant is safe for all fabric including synthetic and natural fibers., Restores lost water and stain properties to factory new levels when applied to clean and dry fabrics by adding a powerful protective unscented coating., 303 Fabric Guard is the only product recommended by and for Sunbrella, as well as other fabric manufacturers to restore lost water properties to fabrics., 303 Fabric Guard will greatly increase water and oil based stain resistance, keeping fabrics dry and maintaining color fastness. Use on upholstery, cushions, umbrellas, life jackets, suede, canvas, and other outdoor fabrics., High quality, premium product. Does not alter fabric color, feel, flammability or breathability.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 303 Fabric Guard Usage Directions Use only on newly, cleaned, dry fabrics. For best results, treat fabrics in warm weather, of at least 70 degrees or warmer. In a well-ventilated area, spray 303 Fabric Guard on fabric until damp, overlapping in a crisscross pattern. Do not saturate. Let dry for 6-12 hours in a clean, dry environment before using or storing. Product liquid and spray are flammable, keep product and treated article (until dry) away from heat, sparks or open flames. 303 Fabric Guard - For Outdoor Fabric - Restores Water Repellency To Factory New Levels - Safe For All Fabrics Product Description 303 Fabric Guard is one of the only product recommended by and for Sunbrella, as well as other fabric manufacturers to restore lost water and stain repellency to fabrics. When applied to clean and dry fabrics, 303 Fabric Guard restores lost water and stain repellency to straight-from-the-factory levels. Keep all your favorite fabrics crisp and clean for years to come. For the best results, thoroughly clean the fabric with 303 Multi-Surface Cleaner. 303 Fabric Guard keeps fabrics fresh, soft, colorful and breathable all while adding a powerful coating to repel water and prevent the most serious of stains Safe for all fabrics, including natural fibers and synthetics Protects patio cushions/pillows, drapes and umbrellas from the outdoor elements Use on fabric awnings, RV covers, fabric convertible tops Made in the U.S.A.

303 Fabric Guard 303 Multi-Surface Cleaner 303 Aerospace Protectant Fabric ✓ ✓ - Leather - ✓ ✓ Rubber - ✓ ✓ Plastic, Plexiglass, Eisenglass - ✓ ✓ Vinyl - ✓ ✓ Metal and Painted Surfaces - ✓ ✓ Suede ✓ ✓ - Canvas ✓ ✓ - Teak - ✓ - Outdoor Carpet and Upholstery Cleaner ✓ ✓ -

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 5.0 out of 5 stars Value priced, meets or exceeds description, works as advertised and is a value.
reviews.reviewText: I purchase several things on Amazon and was giving pretty in-depth reviews. From this point on, here's the new agenda…. if it works as advertised, is well made, meets or exceeds the description, is a value, and arrives in a fair amount of time, it will get a "star rating" equal to what my expectations were/are. If it doesn't meet these criteria, then I will most definitely and descriptively tell the short comings of the products and you as a consumer will not have to go through the trouble of buying the product without some background knowledge. If the sell pulls that item and relists under another description, I will put the exact same review on the seller's feedback page. Sellers have done this a couple of times in the past, and I was true to my word then as well as now. DR

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far the application is easy (due to the soaking in) and the durability is ...
reviews.reviewText: I am using this to replace scotch guard to waterproof my fishing rain gear. The problem with scotch guard is that the propellant (if you will) is water and if there is any water repellency left in the garment the stuff won't soak in so the fabric ends up soaking up water in an extended rain. The 303 has a petrochemical propellant and so does soak into the fabric. So far the application is easy (due to the soaking in) and the durability is superior.9/10/14 I recently spent an extended period in the rain fishing with a newer raincoat treated with 303. With the newer raincoats the fabric breathes but is supposedly waterproof. This is not entirely true. In an extended rain the fabric does not leak but is does saturate or soak into the fabric but does not leak through the fabric. If you are wearing cotton base clothing under the raincoat that clothing gets damp and there goes your insulating factor and your comfort. Obviously you would rather not have the rain soaking in (maybe OK in and umbrella but not so in a coat). That's why having the 303 soak into the fabric is such a big deal. So to the performance, the raingear did not leak and for the most part did not exhibit and signs of water soaking into the fabric. The exception was in areas of high wear or abrasion such as knee area of pants where you might lean an elbow for support. It may be that I didn't do a good job of spraying those areas or it may be that the wear or abrasion caused the treatment to wear off. The breathability (an equally big deal in the comfort category) of the fabric did not seam affected. In any case I had no garment leakage and I was very pleased with the performance and will be buying more in the future.June 15,2015. I did purchase the blue label variety and it does not work as well as the green label. I came back for a gallon this time and am refilling the spray bottle. This stuff is fantastic and I am now spraying raingear for my fishing friends. If you want waterproof rain gear this is the product to buy. My son sprayed some chair seats with this product but so far not spills so no feedback.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Totally works! (Full comparison to Rustoleum NeverWet Outdoor Fabric)
reviews.reviewText: Brief summary: This stuff WORKS to keep outdoor sectional cushions dry. In a comparison of 303 Fabric Guard and Rust-Oleum 278146 NeverWet 11-Ounce Outdoor Fabric Spray, Clear , both are great but 303 is the winner on application, cost efficiency, drying time, look and feel.OVERALL WINNER: 303EASE OF APPLICATION: 303- Rustoleum feels less greasy when wet than 303. The 303 bottle leaked more my hands.- 303's compact spray setting wasted less product than the mist setting on either product. Compact spray still gave an even coating like the mist, and wasted less product.- Both products made cushions appear damp when treated, so it was easy to see where the product was applied.- 303 left less troublesome bubbles than Rustoleum.SCENT: Rustoleum- Both scents are very strong. Apply outdoors.- Rustoleum is pleasantly scented rather than unmasked chemical smell.COST EFFICIENCY: 303- Both products covered less area than they promised. 303 was farther off from its promise than Rustoleum, but still came out cheaper per square foot of coverage.- Rustoleum promised 20-60 square feet of coverage fabric per 11oz at $15. Expected cost: $0.25 to $0.75/square foot.-303 promised 80-200 square feet of coverage per 32oz at $22. Expected cost: $0.11 to $0.27/square foot.- My cushions have a textured heavy fabric. I applied according to instructions, dampening but not saturating the fabric with the product. My 4-piece outdoor sectional with seat and back cushions had 67 square feet of cushion.- One 11oz, $15 bottle of Rustoleum gave 11 square feet of coverage. $1.36 per square foot.- Two 32oz, $22 bottles of 303 covered 56 square feet. $0.78 per square foot.DRYING TIME: 303- 303 required 6-12 hours before use depending on temperature and sunlight.- Rustoleum required 24 hours before exposure to water.- I left both products to dry overnight outside, 70-75 degrees, on a dry night.- Within 3 hours, the 303 cushions started to look dry. After 5 hours, the Rustoleum cushions still looked wet. In the morning both looked totally dry.LOOK AND FEEL WHEN DRY: 303- Neither product changed the color or appearance of the cushions, or caused a change in feel noteworthy enough to outweigh the waterproofing benefits.- Smell: 303’s was gone within 12 hours, and Rustoleum's was gone after 24 hours.- Feel: Both products make the upholstery feel slightly thicker and stiffer.- Texture: Rustoleum has a very slightly rubbery, almost tacky feel while the 303 cushions do not.- Cleaning: Because of the tackiness of the Rustoleum cushions, dirt and pollon stick slightly more, but are easily wiped off with a damp paper towel.WATERPROOFING: Rustoleum, but barely- Both treatments almost completely waterproofed the cushions.- Dew: Morning dew beads up on both 303 and Rustoleum cushions. It can be brushed off completely from the Rustoleum cushions, and can be brushed off with very few droplets soaking in on the 303 cushions. Both are totally dry within an hour of sunlight exposure.- Rain: At the end 2 hours of rain during the day, there was pooling and beading of water on both cushions. After shaking and brushing off the water from the cushions, both were left mildly damp, and were dry and ready to use within 2 hours.- Spills: a full cup of water spilled on either cushion pools, beads, and runs off the sides. After using a paper towel to soak up what remained and brushing off droplets, the cushions were totally dry with no soaking-in through either product. An accidental watermelon spill on a 303 cushion cleaned easily by blotting with a dry paper towel the wiping with a wet paper towel. No word yet on red wine or other spills, but I will update if/when they happen.- Too soon to tell how well it will last.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 30 years old boat cover
reviews.reviewText: So boat cover is 30 years old , it was torn , absolutely filthy. I scrubbed and sewed back up. Prayed ! Had to wait on temperature to come back up. I spread the cover on the dock. But the “303 Fabric Guard“ in small hand pump sprayer. Sprayed the whole gallon on the cover. Let it dry. Put the cover back on the boat. And prayed some more. It worked!!! It was so simple to apply. It saved the boat cover ! Water proof like new !!!
keeps fabrics waterproof and protected for longevity for many years - I apply once or twice yearly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 29, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I use this to waterproof bags I make. However I use it on coats and shoes too. Really brilliant stuff, and although expensive, cheaper to buy like this than the smaller bottles
A l'imperméabilisation d'une capote d'un cabriolet à l'essai du verre d'eau le produit fait bien son effet !!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 23, 2019
reviews.reviewText: I've used this on a fairly heavy and expensive raincoat which the wife would otherwise have thrown out, saving money and penguins. A small part of the ice shelf is that bit safer now. It also worked on an old waxed cotton hat to my surprise. On both items the water just beads up and runs off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 31, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: You need more than you think
reviews.reviewText: Covered an Audi A4 and an MX5.Found it easier to spray and brush it on to cover.Spraying alone would have taken twice as muchHoods now look much improved
